required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Impact of Yogurt on Gastrointestinal Health, Regularity, and Thoughts
clinical_study.official_title: Impact of Yogurt on Gastrointestinal Health, Regularity, and Thoughts

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims to test the central hypothesis that adding to the diet daily yogurt provides beneficial effects on digestive health and subjective mood in healthy adults.

detailed_description.textblock: This clinical trial will include a 4-week lead-in period and a 2-week treatment period. The lead-in period will be devoid of all supplemental and dietary probiotics, fermented dairy products, and fermented foods. Participants will be asked to refrain from consuming all supplemental and dietary probiotics, fermented dairy products, and fermented foods throughout the entire study. During the treatment period, participants will be given yogurt with sugar. This trial will serve as a continuation of the NECTAR Study (NCT04187950).

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Controlled single-group trial with a 4-week lead-in period and a 2-week treatment period. The treatment will consist of yogurt with sugar.
study_design_info.masking_description: Participants will be blinded to the ingredient (sugar) added to the yogurt.

primary_outcome.measure: Intestinal transit time measured using colored dye markers
primary_outcome.description: Determine the impact of consumption of daily yogurt with sugar on intestinal transit time in vivo. Intestinal transit time will be measured using colored dye markers.

secondary_outcome.measure: Digestive health measured using daily stool records with the Bristol Stool Scale
secondary_outcome.description: Determine the impact of consumption of daily yogurt with sugar on digestive health using daily stool records. Within the records, participants rate stool consistency using the Bristol Stool Scale.

secondary_outcome.measure: Digestive health measured using rating scales of additional symptoms in daily stool records
secondary_outcome.description: Determine the impact of consumption of daily yogurt with sugar on other measures of digestive health using daily stool records. Within the records, ratings of additional gastrointestinal symptoms include ease of passage, abdominal pain, bloating, burping, flatulence, nausea, reflux, and rumblings.

secondary_outcome.measure: Digestive health measured using the Gastrointestinal Tolerability questionnaire
secondary_outcome.description: Determine the impact of consumption of daily yogurt with sugar on other measures of digestive health using the Gastrointestinal Tolerability questionnaire. This questionnaire assesses gastrointestinal health through 6 questions related to gastrointestinal health including nausea, bloating, rumblings, gas/flatulence, abdominal pain, and diarrhea. Each of the questions pertains to experience of symptoms in the past 7 days.

secondary_outcome.measure: Digestive health measured using the Gastrointestinal Quality of Life Index (GIQLI) questionnaire
secondary_outcome.description: Determine the impact of consumption of daily yogurt with sugar on other measures of digestive health using the Gastrointestinal Quality of Life Index (GIQLI) questionnaire. The GIQLI assesses gastrointestinal health through a series of 36 questions pertaining to daily life and gastrointestinal symptoms experienced in the past 2 weeks.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mood measured using the Emotional Image Task
secondary_outcome.description: Determine the impact of consumption of daily yogurt with sugar on mood states using the Emotional Image Task. This task measures response to neutral, positive, and negative image stimuli using participant valence, arousal, and dominance ratings.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mood measured using the Positive and Negative Affect Schedule (PANAS) questionnaire
secondary_outcome.description: Determine the impact of consumption of daily yogurt with sugar on mood states using the Positive and Negative Affect Schedule (PANAS) questionnaire. The PANAS assesses general mood using a 20-item scale that includes words associated with either positive (10 words) or negative (10 words) emotions.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mood measured using the Depression, Anxiety, and Stress Scales-42 (DASS-42) questionnaire
secondary_outcome.description: Determine the impact of consumption of daily yogurt with sugar on mood states using the Depression, Anxiety, and Stress Scales-42 (DASS-42) questionnaire. The DASS-42 includes subscales with 42 questions regarding negative emotional states and is used to assess mental health over the past week.

secondary_outcome.measure: Gastrointestinal microbiota assessed using relative abundances
secondary_outcome.description: Determine the impact of daily consumption of yogurt with sugar on the gastrointestinal microbiota. Relative abundances of the gastrointestinal microbiota will be measured with 16S amplicon sequencing.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Yogurt with B. lactis and added cane sugar
arm_group.description: Participants will consume yogurt with B. lactis and added cane sugar twice daily for 14 days.

intervention.intervention_name: Yogurt with B. lactis and added cane sugar
intervention.description: The intervention condition will utilize a commercially available yogurt (Activia) that contains Bifidobacterium animalis lactis DN-173 010/CNCM I-2494 (B. lactis). Participants will consume 170 g of yogurt with cane sugar twice daily for 14 days.
intervention.arm_group_label: Yogurt with B. lactis and added cane sugar

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Males and females
- Between the ages of 22-64 years at the time of consent
- Body mass index of 18.5 to 29.9 kg/m^2.
- Normal or corrected-to-normal vision based on the minimal 20/20 standard in order to complete the cognitive task (below 20/20 vision).
- Ability to drop off fecal sample within 30 minutes of defecation
- Have between 3-6 bowel movements per week
- Have completed the NECTAR Study (NCT04187950)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Current pregnancy, lactation, or post-menopausal
- Tobacco use
- Honey allergy or intolerance
- Dairy allergy, lactose intolerance
- Food dye allergy/intolerance
- Prior physician diagnosed gastrointestinal disease (chronic constipation, diarrhea, Crohn's disease, celiac disease, ulcerative colitis, irritable bowel syndrome, diverticulosis, stomach or duodenal ulcers, hepatitis, or gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD))
- Current use or use of antibiotics in the past 3 months
- Current use of any of the following types of medications: laxatives, anti-diarrhea medications, narcotics, enemas, antispasmodics, anticonvulsants, prescription proton pump inhibitors, prokinetic agents, histamine-2 Rc antagonists (prescription GERD medication)
- Body mass index > 29.9 kg/m^2
- Prior malabsorptive bariatric surgery (i.e. gastric bypass, sleeve gastrectomy)
- Restrictive bariatric surgery (i.e. adjustable gastric band) within the past 5 years
- Concurrent enrollment in another dietary, exercise, or medication study (except for the NECTAR Study (NCT04187950))
